str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To cover, conceal, ward off, bear with, endure patiently. From stege; to roof over, i.e. to cover with silence.
No longer, no more. From me and eti; no further.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To try, tempt, test. From peira; to test, i.e. Endeavor, scrutinize, entice, discipline.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To try, tempt, test. From peira; to test, i.e. Endeavor, scrutinize, entice, discipline.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From kopto; a cut, i.e. toil, literally or figuratively; by implication, pains.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Apparently a primary word; empty.
